title: [Large-Scale] Real-World Financial Decision-Making Simulation: Accounting Ethics and Scientific Crisis Management

context.prior_knowledge: Basic accounting principles, understanding of financial systems, scientific analysis methods (observation, hypothesis formulation, variable control), and data interpretation skills
context.additional_context: In a simulation environment based on real corporate financial data, learners apply scientific methodologies (systematic observation, hypothesis testing, controlled variable experiments) to accumulate practical financial decision-making experience. Training emphasizes enhancing decision reliability through evidence collection and quantitative analysis.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically prepare financial reports according to accounting policies in various financial scenarios and analyze experimental data.

In accounting ethics dilemmas, learners can apply the scientific inquiry method (hypothesis → observation → analysis → conclusion) to derive professional judgment criteria and make evidence-based decisions.
In corporate crisis scenarios, learners can establish stakeholder coordination and collaboration strategies, present optimal solutions based on experimental data with controlled variables.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
